epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

epd_owner.name: Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
epd_owner.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by.name: Edge Environment Pty Ltd
epd_produced_by.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certified_by.name: Epsten Group
epd_process_certified_by.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure, architectural finishes, and other applications.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects with high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

hazardous_substances.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
hazardous_substances.substances_of_very_high_concern: None present exceeding 0.1% of product weight

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

processes_included.upstream: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
processes_included.core: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
processes_included.downstream: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete during use stage onward
carbonation.note: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach conforming to EN 15804

additional_info.sustainability_strategy: Industry's first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
disclaimers: Results of environmental impact indicators with high uncertainties or limited experience should be used with care.
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground.
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing.
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering (2017)

contact_information.holcim_australia_address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
